duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead fundraising efforts through effective fundraisers and sponsorship opportunities.
Develop and implement an annual budget and organizational plan to advance the general welfare and prosperity of the Chamber membership.
Operate the Chamber in accordance with Bylaws, Washington state laws, and Federal laws as proper 501c6 and 501c3 organizations.
Seek out new and grow existing opportunities for sponsorships, partnerships, and grants as a source of funding.
Build and maintain strong relationships and communications with the Board of Directors.
Oversee the development and retention of current and future membership prospects.
Present event opportunities to the Board of Directors and oversee event preparation.
Stay informed on local, state, and federal issues and make recommendations to the Public Policy Committee and/or Board of Directors.
Manage the company's online presence, ensuring a strong digital presence and updating marketing plans to incorporate new strategies.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Business administration, non-profit management, marketing or a related field preferred. Substantial relevant experience may be considered in lieu of the preferred education.
